ai.summary: A challenging 19.2 km hike in the UK along the Octavia Hill Centenary Walk West. The route blends urban sections with countryside trails, featuring elevation changes and scenic views while commemorating Octavia Hill's legacy.
ai.terrain_summary: Mix of city pavements, gravel lanes, rural paths, hedgerows, and occasional steep or uneven sections. Wet weather can create mud; expect some stairs in built-up areas and rocky patches on open trails.
ai.safety_notes: Hard difficulty. Allow 4–6 hours depending on pace and conditions. Navigation can be complex at junctions; carry a map and compass or GPS. Check the forecast and daylight hours; wear sturdy boots and layered clothing. Stay hydrated, carry snacks, and tell someone your planned route. Be prepared for limited phone signal in rural sections and watch for busy roads and weather-related hazards.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline map and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are typically best in the UK, but the route can be tackled year-round with proper gear and planning.
